Line 21: Line 21:
==Cast changes and returning characters==
==Cast changes and returning characters==
â
[[File:KelliGiddishSVU13x01.jpg|thumb|right|200px|[[Kelli Giddish]] portrays [[List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit characters#Amanda Rollins|Detective Amanda Rollins]].]]On May 14, 2011, [[TVLine]] reported that [[Mariska Hargitay]] will return for a thirteenth season while [[Christopher Meloni]] had not come to terms with his contract. Hargitay's character will be paired with what was thought to be Meloni's character for the first 13 episodes. Her character will then be promoted to a supervisor position with a new detective replacing her. NBC was considering [[Jennifer Love Hewitt]] to replace Hargitay.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/05/exclusive-mariska-hargitay-inks-new-law-order-svu-deal-may-pass-baton-to-jennifer-love-hewitt/|title=Law & Order: SVU Scoop: Hargitay Inks New Deal, Jennifer Love Hewitt May Succeed Her|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|work=[[TVLine]]|publisher=[[Mail.com Media]]|date={{nowrap|May 14}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 14}}, 2011}}</ref> Greenblatt later told TVLine, "Jennifer Love is somebody we've been circling, but I don't know that that is going to happen at all".<ref name="MeloniExit">{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/05/chris-meloni-exits-law-order-svu/|title=Exclusive: Chris Meloni Exits Law & Order: SVU|last=Webb Mitovich|first=Matt|last2=Ausiello|first2=|authorlink2=Michael Ausiello|work=TVLine|publisher=Mail.com Media|date={{nowrap|May 24}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 24}}, 2011}}</ref> It was later reported that Jennifer Love Hewitt would not be coming to the show.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/06/svu-update-jennifer-love-hewitt/|title=SVU No Longer Looking to Collar Love Hewitt|last=Masters|first=Meg|work=TVLine|publisher=Mail.com Media|date={{nowrap|June 10}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|June 11}}, 2011}}</ref>
+
[[File:KelliGiddishSVU13x01.jpg|thumb|right|200px|[[Kelli Giddish]] portrays [[List of Law & Order: Special Victims Unit characters#Amanda Rollins|Detective Amanda Rollins]]. {{deletable image-caption|Thursday, 29 September 2011}}]]On May 14, 2011, [[TVLine]] reported that [[Mariska Hargitay]] will return for a thirteenth season while [[Christopher Meloni]] had not come to terms with his contract. Hargitay's character will be paired with what was thought to be Meloni's character for the first 13 episodes. Her character will then be promoted to a supervisor position with a new detective replacing her. NBC was considering [[Jennifer Love Hewitt]] to replace Hargitay.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/05/exclusive-mariska-hargitay-inks-new-law-order-svu-deal-may-pass-baton-to-jennifer-love-hewitt/|title=Law & Order: SVU Scoop: Hargitay Inks New Deal, Jennifer Love Hewitt May Succeed Her|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|work=[[TVLine]]|publisher=[[Mail.com Media]]|date={{nowrap|May 14}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 14}}, 2011}}</ref> Greenblatt later told TVLine, "Jennifer Love is somebody we've been circling, but I don't know that that is going to happen at all".<ref name="MeloniExit">{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/05/chris-meloni-exits-law-order-svu/|title=Exclusive: Chris Meloni Exits Law & Order: SVU|last=Webb Mitovich|first=Matt|last2=Ausiello|first2=|authorlink2=Michael Ausiello|work=TVLine|publisher=Mail.com Media|date={{nowrap|May 24}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 24}}, 2011}}</ref> It was later reported that Jennifer Love Hewitt would not be coming to the show.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/06/svu-update-jennifer-love-hewitt/|title=SVU No Longer Looking to Collar Love Hewitt|last=Masters|first=Meg|work=TVLine|publisher=Mail.com Media|date={{nowrap|June 10}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|June 11}}, 2011}}</ref>
Meloni's contract negotiations fell through, and on {{nowrap|May 24, 2011}}, TVLine reported that he would be exiting the show.<ref name="MeloniExit"/> Mariska Hargitay said that "He inspired me every day with his integrity, his extraordinary talent and his commitment to the truth. I love him deeply and will miss him terribly â Iâm so excited to see what heâll do next."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/05/mariska-hargitay-chris-meloni-law-order-svu-exit/|title=Mariska Hargitay Laments Chris Meloni's SVU Exit: 'I Love Him and Will Miss Him Terribly'|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|work=TVLine|publisher=Mail.com Media|date={{nowrap|May 27}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 27}}, 2011}}</ref>
Meloni's contract negotiations fell through, and on {{nowrap|May 24, 2011}}, TVLine reported that he would be exiting the show.<ref name="MeloniExit"/> Mariska Hargitay said that "He inspired me every day with his integrity, his extraordinary talent and his commitment to the truth. I love him deeply and will miss him terribly â Iâm so excited to see what heâll do next."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/05/mariska-hargitay-chris-meloni-law-order-svu-exit/|title=Mariska Hargitay Laments Chris Meloni's SVU Exit: 'I Love Him and Will Miss Him Terribly'|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|work=TVLine|publisher=Mail.com Media|date={{nowrap|May 27}}, 2011|accessdate={{nowrap|May 27}}, 2011}}</ref>
